name: The Jazz Name Is In The Middle Online Trivia | People | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Tatum.

	Art Tatum (1909-1956) was a true jazz great, who Count Basie called 'the eighth wonder of the world'. Miss O'Neal hasn't recorded a jazz album yet.

Duke.

	Patty is best known for her role as Helen Keller in the 1962 film, 'The Miracle Worker'. Duke Ellington (1899-1974) is best known for his swinging band leading and great jazz compositions, having a lifetime total of 2000 songs.

Davis.

	Miles 'The Prince of Darkness' Davis (1926-1991) was one of jazz music's great innovators. Davis Love III is a PGA Champion, and to my knowledge these two men don't have a darn thing in common.

Louis.

	Joe Louis held a 12 year reign as boxing's Heavyweight Champion of the World, and Louis 'Satchmo' Armstrong (1904-1971) was a 'heavyweight' in the world of jazz music.

James.

	Harry James (1916-1983), husband of actress Betty Grable, was one of the most popular big bandleaders and trumpeters of his day. James Caan is best known for his role as 'Sonny Corleone', in 'The Godfather'.

Lester.

	Richard Lester is best known for directing the Beatles in, 'A Hard Day's Night' and 'Help'. Lester Young (1909-1959) is best known for playing a great sax with the Count Basie Band.

Herman.

	Woodrow Charles Herman (1913-1987) began his musical career in 1934. Herman Melville, best known for penning 'Moby Dick', began his writing career in 1846.

Benny.

	Born Benjamin Kubelsky, Jack Benny was a comedic giant on the radio, on television and in film. Benny Goodman (1909-1986), clarinetist and bandleader, was known as the 'King of Swing' during the jazz era of the 1930s and 40s.

Paul.

	Les Paul was the inventor of the solid-body electric guitar, the 'Gibson Les Paul', which has become a favorite of rock musicians. Paul Whiteman (1890-1967) was the conductor of the 1924 premiere of George Gershwin's, 'Rhapsody in Blue'.

Glenn.

	In 1962, John Glenn piloted the first manned orbital mission of the United States. Glenn Miller (1904-1944) was known for his 'heavenly' music. Although he had hits with sentimental ballads, he is best remembered for his swinging, 'In the Mood' and 'Tuxedo Junction'.
